sen.j: 五世浜村蔵六（ごせい はまむら ぞうろく、男性、慶応2年（1866年） - 明治42年11月25日（1909年））は、明治期の日本の篆刻家である。
sen.e: Zoroku HAMAMURA V (Male, 1866- November 25, 1909) was a tenkokukka (artist of seal engraving) in Meiji Period in Japan.
Zoroku HAMAMURA V (Male, 1866- November 25, 1909) was a tenkokuka (artist of seal engraving) in Meiji Period in Japan.
sen.cmt: kが1つ余計だと思います。
sen.e: Zoroku HAMAMURA V (Male, 1866- November 25, 1909) was a tenkokuka (artist of seal engraving) in Meiji Period in Japan.

sen.j: 名は裕、字は有孚、蔵六を号 (称号)し、別号に無咎道人・彫虫窟主人。
sen.e: His name was Yu, his other name was Yufu, his professional title was Zoroku, and he was also known for two other titles, Mukyudojin and Chochukutsushujin.
sen.cmt: 有孚→ゆうふ、無咎道人→むきゅうどうじん、彫虫窟主人→ちょうちゅうくつしゅじん、としましたがあまり自信がありません。
sen.e: His name was Yu, his other name was Yufu, his professional title was Zoroku, and he was also known for two other titles, Mukyudojin and Chochukutsushujin.
His name was Yu, his other name was Yufu, his professional title was Zoroku, and he was also known for two other titles, Mukyudojin and Chochukutsushujin.

sen.j: 通称立平。
sen.e: He was known by his common name Rippei.
sen.cmt: 立平は「りっぺい」にしましたが、自信がありません。
sen.e: He was known by his common name Rippei.
He was known by his common name Rippei.

sen.j: 陸奥国弘前市出身。
sen.e: He was from Mutsu Province, Hirosaki City.
He was from Hirosaki City, Mutsu Province.
sen.cmt: 住所表記を統一しました。
sen.e: He was from Hirosaki City, Mutsu Province.

sen.j: 略伝
sen.e: Brief Biography
Brief Biography
Brief Biography

sen.j: 三谷大足の次男として生まれ、東奥義塾で洋学を修めた。
sen.e: He was born as the second son of Oashi MITANI and graduated Touougijuku with a major in western studies.
sen.cmt: 三谷大足→みたにおおあし、としましたが自信がありません。
sen.e: He was born as the second son of Daisoku MITANI and graduated Toogijuku with a major in western studies.
He was born as the second son of Daisoku MITANI and graduated Toogijuku with a major in western studies.

sen.j: 23歳のとき上京。
sen.e: He came to Tokyo at the age of twenty-three.
He came to Tokyo at the age of twenty-three.
He came to Tokyo at the age of twenty-three.

sen.j: 金子蓑香に篆刻を学び、その後四世浜村蔵六の門下となる。
sen.e: He studied tenkoku (seal-engraving) under Sakou KANEKO, later he became a disciple of Zoroku HAMAMURA IV.
He studied tenkoku (seal-engraving) under Sakou KANEKO, later he became a disciple of Zoroku HAMAMURA IV.
He studied tenkoku (seal-engraving) under Sakou KANEKO, later he became a disciple of Zoroku HAMAMURA IV.

sen.j: 四世蔵六に継嗣がいなかった為請われてその養子となり、明治27年（1894年）5月浜村蔵六を嗣ぎ、永らく向島 (墨田区)に住む。
sen.e: He was asked and adopted by Zoroku HAMAMURA IV who didn't have an heir as his son and succeeded him in May, 1894; he lived in Mukoujima, Sumida Ward, for a long time.
He was asked and adopted by Zoroku HAMAMURA IV who didn't have an heir as his son and succeeded him in May, 1894; he lived in Mukoujima, Sumida Ward, for a long time.
He was asked and adopted by Zoroku HAMAMURA IV who didn't have an heir as his son and succeeded him in May, 1894; he lived in Mukoujima, Sumida Ward, for a long time.

sen.j: 各地を遊歴後、二度にわたって清国を訪問。
sen.e: After touring all over the country, he visited Qing on two occasions.
After touring all over the country, he visited Qing on two occasions.
After touring all over the country, he visited Qing on two occasions.

sen.j: 康有為ら政治家と親交した。
sen.e: He socialized with Ko Yui (Kang Youwei) and other statesmen.
He socialized with Ko Yui (Kang Youwei) and other statesmen.
He socialized with Ko Yui (Kang Youwei) and other statesmen.

sen.j: また呉昌碩や徐三庚と交わり、その奥義を伝えられる。
sen.e: He also socialized with Goshoseki and Xu Sangeng and learned the esoteric points of their arts.
He also socialized with Goshoseki and Xu Sangeng and learned the esoteric points of their arts.
He also socialized with Goshoseki and Xu Sangeng and learned the esoteric points of their arts.

sen.j: このため浜村家に代々伝えられた印法が変容したとされる。
sen.e: It is said that because of the exchange, the style of inho (sealing way) kept in Hamamura family for generations changed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is said that because of the exchange, the style of inho (sealing way) which had been kept in Hamamura family for generations was modified.
sen.cmt: 前後関係を示すため過去完了にしました。kept in Hamamura family for generations changed → which had been kept in Hamamura family for generations was modified.
sen.e: It is said that because of the exchange, the style of inho (sealing way) which had been kept in Hamamura family for generations was modified.

sen.j: しかし、四世蔵六のとき代々伝えられた印籍類が火災で焼失したことが原因とも考えられる。
sen.e: However, the reason for the change of style might be attributed to the loss of books on tenkoku (engraving letters on the material of a seal) and other materials kept in the family for generations in the fire in Zoroku HAMAMURA V's time.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, the reason for the change of style might be attributed to the loss of books on tenkoku (engraving letters on the material of a seal) and other materials kept in the family for generations in the fire in Zoroku HAMAMURA V's time.

However, the reason for the change of style might be attributed to the loss of books on tenkoku (engraving letters on the material of a seal) and other materials kept in the family for generations in the fire in Zoroku HAMAMURA V's time.

sen.j: 初世蔵六以来の最大の印人と称された。
sen.e: He was said to be the greatest of all tenkokukka since the founder Zoroku.
He was said to be the greatest of all tenkokuka since the founder Zoroku.
sen.cmt: kが1つ余計だと思います。
sen.e: He was said to be the greatest of all tenkokuka since the founder Zoroku.

sen.j: 石印以外にも陶印や金印の制作も巧みであった。
sen.e: He handled different medium well and created stamps in gold and ceramic as well as stone.
He handled different medium well and created stamps in gold and ceramic as well as stone.
He handled different medium well and created stamps in gold and ceramic as well as stone.

sen.j: 印面・鈕形・色彩のすべてに優雅な味わいがあり人気を博した。
sen.e: His stamp's surface, shape, and color, all had refined taste and were very popular.
His stamp's surface, shape, and color, all had refined taste and were very popular.
His stamp's surface, shape, and color, all had refined taste and were very popular.

sen.j: 犬養毅・幸田露伴などの名流がその印を用いた。
sen.e: His seals were used by important personalities such as Tsuyoshi INUKAI and Rohan KODA.
His seals were used by important personalities such as Tsuyoshi INUKAI and Rohan KODA.
His seals were used by important personalities such as Tsuyoshi INUKAI and Rohan KODA.

sen.j: チフスに罹患し病没。
sen.e: He contracted typhoid and died of the disease.
He contracted typhoid and died of the disease.
He contracted typhoid and died of the disease.

sen.j: 享年45。
sen.e: His age at death was 45.
His age at death was 45.
His age at death was 45.

sen.j: 谷中 (台東区)天王寺 (台東区)に墓がある。
sen.e: He was buried in a graveyard of Tenno-ji Temple in Yanaka, Taito Ward.
He was buried in a graveyard of Yanaka Tenno-ji Temple, Taito Ward.
sen.cmt: 用語集に統一しました。
sen.e: He was buried in a graveyard of Yanaka Tenno-ji Temple, Taito Ward.
